Apple___Apple_scab: Apple scab is caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis. It thrives in cool, wet weather and spreads through spores.
Apple___Black_rot: Black rot is caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa. It affects fruit, leaves, and branches.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Cedar apple rust is caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. It requires both apple and cedar trees to complete its life cycle.
Apple___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Blueberry___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: Powdery mildew is caused by the fungus Podosphaera clandestina. It thrives in warm, dry conditions.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray: Gray leaf spot is caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_: Common rust is caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi. It thrives in cool, wet weather.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Northern leaf blight is caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Grape___Black_rot: Black rot is caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): Esca is caused by a complex of fungi, including Phaeomoniella chlamydospora and Phaeoacremonium aleophilum.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Leaf blight is caused by the fungus Isariopsis griseola. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Grape___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): Citrus greening is caused by the bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus. It is spread by the Asian citrus psyllid.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Bacterial spot is caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas arboricola pv. pruni. It thrives in warm, wet conditions.
Peach___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Bacterial spot is caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria. It thrives in warm, wet conditions.
Pepper,_bell___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Potato___Early_blight: Early blight is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight: Late blight is caused by the fungus Phytophthora infestans. It thrives in cool, wet conditions.
Potato___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Raspberry___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Soybean___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: Powdery mildew is caused by the fungus Podosphaera xanthii. It thrives in warm, dry conditions.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Leaf scorch is caused by the fungus Diplocarpon earlianum. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Strawberry___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Bacterial spot is caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria. It thrives in warm, wet conditions.
Tomato___Early_blight: Early blight is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Late_blight: Late blight is caused by the fungus Phytophthora infestans. It thrives in cool, wet conditions.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Leaf mold is caused by the fungus Passalora fulva. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Septoria leaf spot is caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Spider mites are tiny arachnids that feed on plant sap, causing yellowing and stippling of leaves.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Target spot is caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus is transmitted by the whitefly Bemisia tabaci. It causes stunting and yellowing of leaves.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: Tomato mosaic virus is transmitted by contact or through seeds. It causes mottling and distortion of leaves.
Tomato___healthy: The plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
